en_text: By grandson you mean...
jp_text: あの…　孫って

en_text: that one, right?
jp_text: あれですよね

en_text: It just sort of happened.
jp_text: あれです

en_text: Yamagami-san.
jp_text: 山神さん

en_text: Is there a trick to talking with Tanaka-san?
jp_text: 田中さんと話すコツとかありますか
google_translated: Is there a tip to talk to Mr. Tanaka?

en_text: Huh? A trick?
jp_text: えっ　コツですか

en_text: Like from when you were out with him the other day?
jp_text: 先日の飲み会の教訓とか
google_translated: Lessons of drinking party the other day

en_text: Um, um, um, um, um, um...
jp_text: えっと…　えっと…　えっと…

en_text: I'm sorry. That was a difficult question.
jp_text: すみません　難しい質問をしてしまいました
google_translated: Excuse me I have had a difficult question

en_text: Hasebe.
jp_text: 長谷部

en_text: It's none of my business, so I don't want to say too much,
jp_text: 当人同士のことだから　口出ししたくねえけど
google_translated: It's a matter of people, so I want to make a mouth

en_text: What are you possibly talking about, Hasebe?
jp_text: 何のこと言ってるんだ　長谷部

en_text: Will the two of them be okay?
jp_text: ダメでしょうね

en_text: Please take this side.
jp_text: どうぞ

en_text: Only on the surface.
jp_text: 確かに外見だけなら

en_text: I won't be drinking, but I guess\N I can have him pour me a glass.
jp_text: 飲めないけど　一応注いでもらっておこう
google_translated: I can not drink it, but let's get it first

en_text: So, Hasebe earlier...
jp_text: それで　長谷部が

en_text: Oh, yes?
jp_text: いや　さっき長谷部がですね

en_text: And then Hasebe...
jp_text: 長谷部なもので

en_text: Oh, I get told that a lot.
jp_text: 田中さんはおばあちゃん似なんですね

en_text: Could we maybe try talking about\N something other than Hasebe-san?
jp_text: あの　試しに　長谷部さん以外の話をしてみていただけませんか
google_translated: Could you talk to that test other than Hasegana?

en_text: Po...
jp_text: ポ…

en_text: "Po"?
jp_text: ポ？

en_text: About portfolio management services...
jp_text: ポートフォリオ・マネジメントサービスについて

en_text: Well it's just... you picked such a boring topic for conversation,
jp_text: ただの年下でくそ真面目で話しのつまらない男の人だったわ
google_translated: It was just a boring man who was talking seriously late

en_text: I'm sort of relieved.
jp_text: えっ　す…すみません　つまらなくて

en_text: He seemed scary at first, but he's just a kid
jp_text: ああ　なんだか安心した　怖い人だと思ってたけど
google_translated: Oh, I thought it was a scary person who was relieved

en_text: Miyoshi-san?!
jp_text: 三好さん？

en_text: Miyoshi-san?! Please get a hold of yourself!
jp_text: 三好さん　しっかりしてください

en_text: I'm not concerned about that.
jp_text: そうではなくてですね

en_text: Huh? What situation?
jp_text: はあ　どの状態？

en_text: N-Never mind. Please just put me down.
jp_text: よかったら　またお願いします
google_translated: Please ask again if you like

en_text: I'm sorry for passing out.
jp_text: あの　すみません　酔いつぶれてしまって

en_text: It was actually kind of fun. Let's do this again.
jp_text: なんだか楽しかったです

en_text: Not to mention, we never got to talk about regrets at all.
jp_text: というか　後悔の話　一切出来なかったですし
google_translated: I could not talk to the story of regret

en_text: Y-You're right...
jp_text: そ…そうでした

en_text: My head hurts.
jp_text: 頭痛い

en_text: Miyoshi-san, good morning.
jp_text: おはようございます

en_text: Was everything all right yesterday?
jp_text: 昨日は大丈夫でしたか

en_text: Huh? Oh, yeah, everything was fine.
jp_text: えっ　ああ　大丈夫でした

en_text: Well, in the end...
jp_text: まあ　結果的に

en_text: In the end?
jp_text: 結果的に？

en_text: Pukari beranda no otsukisama mitsumetara
jp_text: 田中さんは長谷部さんがいなければいい
google_translated: Mr. Tanaka should have no Hasegan club

en_text: It'll be a good day
jp_text: それはどこでしょう

en_text: This week's Servant Quiz!
